pullRequest.body:
Prove the formula for the integral against the composition of kernels. This is a simplified version of the proof for the composition-product which is in the same file. However we need to do all the proofs again because the results about composition-product require s-finiteness while composition do not.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #22362

### PR summary [8459792950](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22363/commits/84597929509b732e071f9742c1e87a6d5d5e2a65)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ProbabilityTheory.measurableSet_integrable`
`+ StronglyMeasurable.integral_kernel`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable.comp`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.AEStronglyMeasurable.integral_kernel_comp`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.Integrable.ae_of_comp`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.Integrable.ae_of_compProd`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.Integrable.integral_comp`
`+ _root_.MeasureTheory.Integrable.integral_norm_comp`
`+ comp_add_left`
`+ comp_add_right`
`+ comp_eq_comp_const_apply`
`+ continuous_integral_integral_comp`
`+ hasFiniteIntegral_comp_iff`
`+ hasFiniteIntegral_comp_iff'`
`+ integrable_comp_iff`
`+ integral_comp`
`+ integral_fn_integral_add_comp`
`+ integral_fn_integral_sub_comp`
`+ integral_integral_add'_comp`
`+ integral_integral_add_comp`
`+ integral_integral_sub'_comp`
`+ integral_integral_sub_comp`
`+ lintegral_fn_integral_sub_comp`
`+ setIntegral_comp`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR adds to the evidence that using the composition-product as main building block for kernels was a bad idea. I think we will soon need a refactor, to build first the composition (no s-finite assumption needed), then the parallel product (s-finiteness is used there), then define the composition product using those and some deterministic kernels, as follows:
Îº âŠ—â‚– Î· = swap âˆ˜â‚– (Î· âˆ¥ id) âˆ˜â‚– MeasurableEquiv.prodAssoc âˆ˜â‚– (id âˆ¥ copy) âˆ˜â‚– (id âˆ¥ Îº) âˆ˜â‚– copy

That is, we should use the building blocks that people use when talking about Markov categories.

There is nothing you need to do about that in this PR, but I just wanted to comment on the duplicated proofs issue.
Indeed this duplication is kind of ugly. Let me know if you need help for the refactor.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#22362~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Can you merge master to reduce the diff?

Could you also use these results to remove s-finite assumptions in [MeasureTheory.Measure.ae_integrable_of_integrable_comp](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Probability/Kernel/Composition/MeasureComp.html#MeasureTheory.Measure.ae_integrable_of_integrable_comp) and the lemma below it?
I added more lemmas for comp which already existed for compProd to drop s-finiteness. Do you want me to split the PR or is it fine as it is?

Thanks! The PR is fine as it is: it's not that big.
(but CI is currently failing)

Thanks!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13585534134/job/37979537231)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13585534134/job/37979537533)

```suggestion
composition-product. However it is necessary to do all the proofs once again because the
```
Please add deprecations.
I moved the results in another file which is not imported by this one so I can't put the new names in this file. Should I change the imports?

I am confused: I thought that your new lemmas implied that simp could prove this, which meant that those two could be deleted. But you are telling me that your new lemmas are not even imported here, so I guess that those two results were not used anyway? How did you find out that those duplicates were here to delete them?

The simp linter told me there was a conflict between `comp_add` and `bind_add`, so that's how I found them, and because they were not about invariance I thought they would be better in the file about the composition of a kernel and a measure. I think the simp linter cross checks all the simp lemmas regardless of the imports?

I agree that the lemmas are better elsewhere. I did not know that the linter worked like that.
Let's just delete without deprecation then, I guess?
I think the idea is that even though the lemmas are not imported in the same file right now they might be in the future so this avoids potential future conflicts.
I think it's rather safe to delete without deprecations, but maybe we should ask on Zulip?
In fact I just remembered I already encountered this situation, the thing to do is to refer to the new lemma in the deprecation message.

Reverse left and right in the names? `compProd_add_left` is `(Î¼ + Îº) âŠ—â‚– Î· = Î¼ âŠ—â‚– Î· + Îº âŠ—â‚– Î·`, and I understand left and right as refering to a side of the notation for the operation.
Can you move this lemma to the file Mathlib.Probability.Kernel.MeasurableIntegral, where `StronglyMeasurable.integral_kernel_prod_right` and friends are defined?

`comp` seems a bit too generic for a name. Perhaps this?
```suggestion
theorem _root_.MeasureTheory.Integrable.ae_of_comp â¦ƒf : Î³ â†’ Eâ¦„ (hf : Integrable f ((Î· âˆ˜â‚– Îº) a)) :
```
The name for the compProd version is `compProd_mk_left_ae`, which is not great either :)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: integral against the composition of kernels
